sentences.english: He faces an uphill battle against either Obama or Clinton.
sentences.chinese: 他將面對與奧巴馬或者希拉里的升級選戰。

sentences.english: Relocation is the main campaign issue.
sentences.chinese: 基地遷建問題是選戰的主題。

sentences.english: But Democrats prevailed in a number of close races.
sentences.chinese: 不過，民主黨人在若干難分伯仲的選戰中獲勝。

sentences.english: S. presidential candidates are making last-minute appeals in hotly contested states in advance of Tuesday's election.
sentences.chinese: 兩位主要候選人正在一些選戰激烈的州做最後的衝刺。

sentences.english: Opposition leader Tshisekedi says the contest must not be postponed.
sentences.chinese: 反對派領導人齊塞凱迪表示，這場選戰一定不能推遲。

sentences.english: But, I have to admit, this has been one of the toughest.
sentences.chinese: 我必須承認，這次選戰是一次艱難的較量。

definition: the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to take part in an election/to run for office
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
